lines.text: Warranty On Hearing Aids

spans.text: Warranty On Hearing Aids

lines.text: The California Song-Beverly Consumer Warranty Act provides a 30-day warranty on all new and used

spans.text: Application of the Law

lines.text: The hearing aid may be returned at any time within 30 days after the date of the actual delivery or

spans.text: The hearing aid may be returned at any time within 30 days after the date of the actual delivery or

lines.text: completion of the fitting, whichever occurs later. For example, if the device is ordered on July 1, and

spans.text: completion of the fitting, whichever occurs later.  For example, if the device is ordered on July 1, and

spans.text: delivered on July 15, it may be returned for adjustment or replacement through August 15.  If, however, the

spans.text: process of the fitting only begins on July 15 and the fitting is not completed until August 20, the buyer is

lines.text: Buyer’s and Seller’s Responsibilities

spans.text: Buyer’s and Seller’s Responsibilities

lines.text: The hearing aid dispenser must act in good faith in honoring the buyer's rights, and the buyer, too, must act in

spans.text: The hearing aid dispenser must act in good faith in honoring the buyer's rights, and the buyer, too, must act in

lines.text: good faith in enforcing such rights. Whether the device is or is not specifically fit for the buyer's particular

spans.text: good faith in enforcing such rights.  Whether the device is or is not specifically fit for the buyer's particular

spans.text: needs will always be a question of fact.  The fact that the buyer sincerely believes that the device is unfit is

lines.text: The buyer does not have an unqualified option to return the device for a refund and may return the hearing aid

lines.text: The hearing aid dispenser is not required by law to provide a refund if:

spans.text: The hearing aid dispenser is not required by law to provide a refund if:

lines.text: (a) the device has been abused or damaged by the buyer;

spans.text: (a) the device has been abused or damaged by the buyer;

lines.text: (b) the buyer keeps the device for more than 30 days after delivery without seeking an adjustment;

spans.text: (b) the buyer keeps the device for more than 30 days after delivery without seeking an adjustment;

lines.text: (c) the buyer does not allow the dispenser an opportunity to adjust, repair or replace the device;

spans.text: (c) the buyer does not allow the dispenser an opportunity to adjust, repair or replace the device;

lines.text: (d) the buyer feels he/she paid too much and returns the hearing aid; or

spans.text: (d) the buyer feels he/she paid too much and returns the hearing aid; or

lines.text: (e) the hearing aid is returned after the death of the buyer.

spans.text: (e) the hearing aid is returned after the death of the buyer.

lines.text: It is important that both the buyer and the seller keep accurate written records of the dates of all adjustments.

spans.text: It is important that both the buyer and the seller keep accurate written records of the dates of all adjustments.

lines.text: In a dispute, the records will be essential in making a determination of the issue.

lines.text: The Hearing Aid Dispensers Bureau's mission is to protect consumers through its licensing and

spans.text: The Hearing Aid Dispensers Bureau's mission is to protect consumers through its licensing and

lines.text: enforcement functions. Consumers are encouraged to file a formal complaint if there is any question
